alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Madison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 11:04AM EST until March 09 at 8:43AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... White River and Eel River. .Ongoing and renewed flooding will continue or develop along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers over the next 24 to 48 hours and beyond. River stages are rising again due to the one to over two and a half inches of rain received from Saturday night through this morning. Minor flooding is expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Muncie. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Riverview and McCulloch Parks, including park roads, begin to flood. Backyards of houses in Yorktown along Buck Creek begin to flood. Backyards of houses and outbuildings along White River in Muncie begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 9.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued later this evening.
